quotes.quote: A wisely chosen illustration is almost essential to fasten the truth upon the ordinary mind, and no teacher can afford to neglect this part of his preparation.
Illustrations can be a big window: a looking glass into the author's imagination.
No man with a conscience can just bat out illustrations. He's got to put all his talent and feeling into them!
A witty illustration or an apt story will accomplish more than columns of argument.
An illustration is a visual editorial - its just as nuanced. Everything that goes into it is a call you make: every color, every line weight, every angle.
I was tired of illustration. You'd work so hard on a commission and it would go in to a magazine, and you'd turn the page and it was gone.
You have to make thousands and thousands of drawings before an illustration is perfected.
Illustration is commercial. It's work that we produce, and I think what you can do is you can draw from the pool of art, but most of it comes from a pool of knowledge.

Illustrations have as much to say as the text. The trick is to say the same thing, but in a different way. It's no good being an illustrator who is saying a lot that is on his or her mind, if it has nothing to do with the text. . . the artist must override the story, but he must also override his own ego for the sake of the story.
The illustration which solves one difficulty by raising another, settles nothing.
My life is an open book. With illustrations.
There is no line between fine art and illustration; there is no high or low art; there is only art, and it comes in many forms.
We may smile at these matters, but they are melancholy illustrations.
Dreams are illustrations from the book your soul is writing about you.
A picture should be a re-creation of an event rather than an illustration of an object; but there is no tension in the picture unless there is a struggle with the object.
